radiographic_examinations.findings: Hilar lymphadenopathy and multiple nodular opacities throughout both lungs, more prominent in the middle and lower zones.
Multifocal ill-defined nodular opacities throughout all lung lobes, superimposed areas of consolidation, scattered ground-glass opacities, and mediastinal and hilar lymphadenopathy.
A small pleural effusion on the right side; otherwise normal.
Bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy, more prominent on the right side; no evidence of deep venous thrombosis.
